body_html:
@asimshankar Sorry for lack of updates.

I was able to find a Windows VM with Visual Studio 2017 preinstalled license from https://developer.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/downloads/virtual-machines (license will expire in 05/13).

However, it appears that TensorFlow currently does not work well with Visual Studio 2017 build.

I have tried multiple times but still could not get a successful Windows build first (either with cmake or with bazel). Therefore unable to move forward to debug the issue of utf8 string with Windows.

GIven the current status I think it might make sense to close this PR or label it as stalled for now. I will give it another try and if I am able to move forward again, will open the new PR.

Thanks for the help during the process and sorry for the inconvenience.

body:
@asimshankar Sorry for lack of updates.

I was able to find a Windows VM with Visual Studio 2017 preinstalled license  from https://developer.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/downloads/virtual-machines (license will expire in 05/13).

However, it appears that TensorFlow currently does not work well with Visual Studio 2017 build.

I have tried multiple times but still could not get a successful Windows build first (either with cmake or with bazel). Therefore unable to move forward to debug the issue of utf8 string with Windows.

GIven the current status I think it might make sense to close this PR or label it as `stalled` for now. I will give it another try and if I am able to move forward again, will open the new PR.

Thanks for the help during the process and sorry for the inconvenience.
